dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 1787 IH: To provide that the pueblo of Santa Clara may lease for 99 years certain restricted land, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Ben Ray Luján of New Mexico (for himself and Ms. Michelle Lujan Grisham of New Mexico) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To provide that the pueblo of Santa Clara may lease for 99 years certain restricted land, and for other purposes.

section.header: Expansion of pueblo of Santa Clara land eligible for 99-year lease
section.text: Subsection (a) of the first section of the Act of August 9, 1955 (commonly known as the Long-Term Leasing Act) (25 U.S.C. 415(a)), is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by striking Indians,, and inserting Indians,;
by inserting Ohkay Owingeh pueblo, after Cochiti,;
by inserting the pueblo of Santa Clara, after Pojoaque,;
by striking the the lands and inserting the land;
by striking lands held in trust for the Pueblo of Santa Clara,; and
by striking lands held in trust for Ohkay Owingeh Pueblo.
